title: Comparative Analysis of Learning Experiences from a Gender-Perspective: A Case Study of Women-Only Classes

context.prior_knowledge: Adult education theory and foundational knowledge in gender sociology
context.additional_context: A research-based course where professionals in medical/legal/technical fields compare gender-based differences in learning environments. Participants conduct comparative analyses of existing mixed-gender and women-only class experiences

learning_goals: Participants can explain the impact of gender socialization processes on learning engagement with three or more specific examples.
Participants can write an analytical report comparing improved learning outcomes in women-only classroom environments using quantitative/qualitative metrics.
Participants can propose gender-sensitive instructional design plans applicable to workplace environments based on research findings.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
